New Records: For the first time in the history of the UEFA European Championship group stage, all four teams in a single group will be level on points going into the final round of matches.
Youri Tielemans’ strike after one minute and 13 seconds is Belgium’s earliest ever goal at a major tournament (World Cup/Euros), and the third-fastest overall in UEFA European Championship history.
Jan Vertonghen (37 years, 59 days) became the oldest player to appear for Belgium at the UEFA European Championships and the third-oldest at a major tournament (EUROs + World Cup).
Key Match Events: Kevin De Bruyne scored a second goal to wrap up a win for Belgium.
Youri Tielemans scored the first goal of the game after just 73 seconds.
Romania's Dennis Man had a key chance but hit his shot straight at Casteels.
Kevin De Bruyne scored his second goal after a long ball from Casteels.
Pre-Game Insights: In the lead-up to Euro 2024, there was talk about whether Belgium’s golden generation could achieve something historic.
Belgium's manager Domenico Tedesco emphasized the importance of a must-win game.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory leaves Group E as open as it could possibly be, with all four teams tied on three points.
With De Bruyne on form, Belgium are favorites to beat Ukraine and advance to the knockout stage.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Romania had the lowest possession share by a victorious team on record at the Euros in their first match against Ukraine.
Belgium had two goals disallowed in their previous match against Slovakia.
